p: Sendai virus (SeV; Cantell strain) was obtained from Charles River Laboratories and propagated in 10-day old embryonated chicken eggs. The A/Puerto Rico/8/1934 virus was propagated in 8-day old, specific pathogen-free embryonated eggs (Charles River Laboratories; North Franklin, CT). Influenza virus titers were determined by plaque assay using MDCK cells.
